src:
Menuju Sea Games 2019 : Antisipasi Virus Polio, Kontingen Indonesia Wajib Suntik Vaksinasi
06 Nov 2019, 05:50 by Danang Sundoro



Menuju Sea Games 2019 : Antisipasi Virus Polio, Kontingen Indonesia Wajib Suntik Vaksinasi



Menuju Sea Games 2019 : Antisipasi Virus Polio, Kontingen Indonesia Wajib Suntik Vaksinasi



Menuju Sea Games 2019 : Antisipasi Virus Polio, Kontingen Indonesia Wajib Suntik Vaksinasi


KBRN, Jakarta : Virus Polio yang melanda Filipina cukup berdampak. Apalagi,  pemerintah Indonesia dan Filipina yang menjadi tuan rumah SEA Games XXX, tanggal 30 November hingga 11 Desember 2019 sudah mengeluarkan travel warning terkait out brake polio tersebut.Untuk itu,  seluruh anggota Kontingen Indonesia mulai dari atlet, offisial dan non offisial diminta wajib memiliki buku sertifikat vaksinasi internasional (International SertIficate of Vaccinations or Prophylaxis) yang dikeluarkan Kementerian Kesehatan Republik Indonesia sebagai bukti bahwa mereka sudah menjalani vaksinasi polio."Seluruh anggota Kontingen Indonesia harus melakukan vaksinasi yang dibuktikan dengan buku sertifikat vaksinasi internasional untuk bisa masuk ke Filipina. Kalau tidak memiliki buku sertifikat itu akan mengalami kesulitan untuk masuk ke Filipina, " kata Tim Kesehatan Kontingen Indonesia, Anggota Medis  Kontingen Indonesia, dr Pudji Widodo dan Koordinator Medis Kontingen Indonesia, Kol Laut (K) Dr Wiweka MARS saat mendampingi Timnas Hoki Indonesia menjalani vaksinasi polio  di Kantor Kesehatan Pelabuhan (KKP) Kelas I Soekarno-Hatta Banten, Selasa, (5/11/2019) malam.  Penyuntikan vaksinasi polio ini, kata Pudji, bertujuan agar seluruh anggota Kontingen Indonesia tidak terjangkit virus Polio. "Vaksinasi ini sangat penting bagi atlet sehingga tidak gampang terjangkit virus polio. Jangan sampai prestasi atlet terganggu gara-gara virus polio yang menyerang otot. Begitu juga dengan offisial dan non offisial serta suporter yang akan memberikan dukungan langsung ke Filipina," jelasnya.  Menurut Pudji, program penyuntikan vaksinasi pertama memang sengaja dilakukan terhadap timnas Hoki yang menjalani Trainning Camp dan uji coba di Ceko. Pasalnya, Tim Medis Kontingen mentargetkan seluruh anggota Kontingen Indonesia sudah menjalani vaksinasi 17 November 2019. "Timnas Hoki Indonesia lebih awal menjalani vaksinasi polio karena mereka baru kembali menjalani uji coba dari Ceko tanggal 21 November mendatang. Perlu diketahui bahwa kekebalan tubuh itu terbangun setelah dua minggu suntikan. Jadi, idealnya sebelum dua minggu sebelum bertolak semua sudah disuntik vaksinasi," tandasnya.   Ketika disinggung mengenai wartawan olahraga yang akan meliput SEA Games XXX Filipina 2019, dr Wiweka yang juga Kepala RSAL Mintoharjo Jakarta menambahkan, masalah itu tidak perlu khawatir. Sebab, Chef de Mission (CdM), Harry Warganegara sudah berkoordinasi dan menjalin kerja sama dengan Kementerian Pemuda dan Olahraga (Kemenpora). "Kita nanti akan umumkan rumah sakit mana yang bisa didatangi wartawan untuk menjalani vaksinasi polio. Prinsipnya, semua biaya ditanggung Kemenpora. Nanti, kita akan segera umumkan," ujarnya. Ketika disinggung bagaimana jika suntikan virus polio itu mengandung obat-obatan yang masuk kategori doping? Pudji menjawab, "Kita akan mengeluarkan surat keterangan resmi kepada penyelenggara sehingga tidak terkena sanksi bilamana vaksinasi itu masuk kategori doping." lanjutnya.Secara terpisah, Kepala Kantor Kesehatan Pelabuhan Kelas I Bandara Soekarno-Hatta Banten, dr Anas Ma'ruf mengatakan, pihaknya mendukung kegiatan vaksinasi virus polio untuk bisa memastikan agar seluruh Kontingen Indonesia tidak terjangkit virus polio. Bahkan, ia menyebut pihaknya akan menyiapkan jalur khusus yang akan dilalui seluruh Kontingen Indonesia saat kembali ke Tanah Air. Tujuannya, mendeteksi anggota kontingen Indonesia yang terjangkit virus polio. "Kita akan menyiapkan alat deteksi suhu badan dan juga menurunkan tim yang akan memantau bilamana ada  anggota  Kontingen Indonesia yang terjangkit virus untuk segera ditangani. Jadi, virus itu tidak menyebar ke Indonesia," tegasnya. Selaku CdM, Hary sangat mendukung langkah baik ini,demi kenyamanan dan keamanan khususnya kesehatan para peliput, para peserta Sea Games 2019 dan semua pihak yang akan membantu menyukseskan kontingen Indonesia di Filipina. "Selaku CdM, saya dan NOC Indonesia sangat mengapresiasi support dan reaksi cepat pemerintah khususnya Kemenkes dan Kemenpora RI dalam mensupport atlet dan Official Seagames 2019 ini,"tutur Harry Warganegara dalam keterangan tertulisnya kepada Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI), Rabu (6/11/2019).Untuk menghindari terjangkit virus polio,  Puji juga meminta seluruh anggota kontingen Indonesia dan suporter menerapkan pola hidup sehat selama tinggal di Filipina. Pasalnya, virus polio itu bisa menular melalui kotoran dan lewat mulut. "Seluruh anggota Kontingen Indonesia harus menerapkan pola hidup sehat selama di sana. Makanan dan minuman yang dikonsumsi harus dipastikan higenis. Usahakan jika setiap mau mengkonsumi makanan sebaiknya mencuci tangan dengan antiseptik," terangnya.
text:
Heading to the 2019 Sea Games: Anticipating Polio Virus, Indonesian Contingent Must Have Vaccination Injections
06 Nov 2019, 05:50 by Danang Sundoro



Heading to the 2019 Sea Games: Anticipating Polio Virus, Indonesian Contingent Must Have Vaccination Injections



Heading to the 2019 Sea Games: Anticipating Polio Virus, Indonesian Contingent Must Have Vaccination Injections



Heading to the 2019 Sea Games: Anticipating Polio Virus, Indonesian Contingent Must Have Vaccination Injections


KBRN, Jakarta: The Polio Virus that has hit the Philippines has quite an impact. Moreover, the governments of Indonesia and the Philippines, which hosted the SEA Games XXX, from 30 November to 11 December 2019 had issued a travel warning related to the polio out brake. For that reason, all Indonesian Contingent members ranging from athletes, officials and non-officials were required to have books international certificate of vaccination (International Certificate of Vaccinations or Prophylaxis) issued by the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Indonesia as proof that they have undergone polio vaccination. "All members of the Indonesian Contingent must carry out vaccinations as evidenced by an international vaccination certificate book to enter the Philippines. the certificate book will have difficulty entering the Philippines, "said the Indonesian Contingent Health Team, Indonesian Contingent Medical Members, Dr. Pudji Widodo and the Indonesian Contingent Medical Coordinator, Kol Laut (K) Dr Wiweka MARS while accompanying the Indonesian Hockey National Team undergoing vaccination olio at the Soekarno-Hatta Banten Class I Port Health Office (KKP), Tuesday (11/05/2019) night. The injection of polio vaccination, said Pudji, aims to prevent all members of the Indonesian contingent from contracting the Polio virus. "This vaccination is very important for athletes so that it is not easy to get infected by the polio virus. Do not let the athlete's achievements be disturbed because of the polio virus that attacks the muscles. Likewise with official and non-official as well as supporters who will provide direct support to the Philippines," he explained. According to Pudji, the first vaccination injection program was deliberately carried out against the Hockey national team who underwent Trainning Camp and trials in the Czech Republic. Because the Contingent Medical Team is targeting all Indonesian contingent members to have been vaccinated on November 17, 2019. "The Indonesian Hockey National Team earlier underwent a polio vaccination because they had just returned to the Czech test on November 21. Please note that the immune system was awakened after two weeks. "So, ideally before two weeks before leaving, all have been vaccinated," he said. When mentioned about sports journalists who would cover the 2019 SEA Games in the Philippines in 2019, Dr. Wiweka who is also the Head of Mintoharjo Jakarta Hospital added that the problem was nothing to worry about. Because, Chef de Mission (CdM), Harry Citizen has coordinated and established cooperation with the Ministry of Youth and Sports (Kemenpora). "We will announce which hospital reporters can go to for polio vaccination. In principle, all costs will be borne by the Ministry of Youth and Sports. Later, we will announce it soon," he said. When alluded to what if the polio virus injection contains drugs that fall into the category of doping? Pudji replied, "We will issue an official statement to the organizers so that they will not be penalized if the vaccination is classified as doping." he continued. Separately, the Head of the Class I Port Health Office of Soekarno-Hatta Airport in Banten, Dr. Anas Ma'ruf said, he supports the polio virus vaccination activity to ensure that all Indonesian contingents are not infected with the polio virus. In fact, he said it would prepare a special path that would be passed by the entire Indonesian contingent when returning to the country. The goal is to detect members of the Indonesian contingent who contracted the polio virus. "We will prepare a body temperature detection device and also send a team that will monitor when there are members of the Indonesian contingent who contract the virus to be treated immediately. So, the virus does not spread to Indonesia," he said. As CdM, Hary strongly supports this good step, for the sake of comfort and safety, especially the health of the reporters, participants of the 2019 Sea Games and all those who will help the success of the Indonesian contingent in the Philippines. "As CdM, Indonesia and I NOC greatly appreciate the support and rapid reaction of the government, especially the Ministry of Health and the Republic of Indonesia Ministry of Youth and Sports in supporting the 2019 Official Seagames and athletes," said Harry Citizen in his written statement to Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI), Wednesday (6/11 / 2019). To avoid contracting the polio virus, Puji also asked all Indonesian contingent members and supporters to adopt a healthy lifestyle while living in the Philippines. Because the polio virus can be transmitted through dirt and through the mouth. "All members of the Indonesian contingent must adopt a healthy lifestyle while there. Food and drink consumed must be ensured hygienic. Try if every person who consumes food should wash their hands with antiseptic," he explained.
